lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's out for PS4, Xbox One, and PC. The latest installment of Far Cry, if you guys aren't familiar with it, is set in the fictional Hope County, Montana, where a fanatical doomsday cult known as the Project at Eden's Gate has taken control. If you are playing it or plan to play it, you'll probably hear me and Marisha somewhere in that cult, I'm sure, or scattered in the game at some point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're cultists?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've always known that about you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's my true destiny, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I got to work on my Montana for that one. It was fun. It strangely is. Sorry, Montana. Grab your sidekick, train your dog, and fight against Eden's Gate in the most Far Cry way possible, which is with extreme force, so pick up a copy today. Hope you enjoy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The prologue is so good it is currently encompassing Brian Wayne Foster's life.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This game is a lot of people's lives. I've watched people vanish over the past couple days.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Raving about it. It's only been out for five seconds, and everyone's gaga.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No! No, why?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bonzai, wave hogs and hog-ettes, it's Brody Slater, king of the kick-flip, jamming about the froobs at D&D Beyond. You all know I love letting my leash out on maxed shore breaks at Steamer Lane. Real bang! When I'm not flashing the shaka at some quimby on a softboard, I'm chillaxing with my buds with some gnarly roleplaying games. Now, I'm partial to Dead Earth, Empire of Satanis, and F.A.T.A.L.-- slotted!-- but my broheims are hooked on fifth edition, which means I get stoked for D&D Beyond. If there's one thing Brody Slater loves more than shacked eskimo rolls, it's diligent organization. Right now, you can go to D&D Beyond's Facebook page and leave a comment on their top (stammers) pinned post, telling them your favorite moment for episode 11 of Critical Role to be entered to win a legendary bundle. Far out! So don't be a Benny Poser, head on over to D&D Beyond and enter now. Hang 11! (cheering and clapping)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If Shakäste comes back later on, you can play his spiritual weapon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That made me uncomfortable so fast.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The character didn't click until he said he played F.A.T.A.L., and then I was, oh, I know who this is now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't even know what that is, I looked it up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't. It's awful. It's the worst.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that the third time we've had him? In our lifetime?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm a fan of my own character.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like Halley's Comet, you always come around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam, and thank you to D&D Beyond for being awesome supporters of the show. A couple quick things after that. First off, reminding you guys about Twitch Prime. If you have an Amazon Prime account, you can connect it to your Twitch account, and every month you can subscribe for free to a channel of your choice. Whether that'd be us or anybody else you'd want to show some love to, costs you nothing and it's pretty awesome, so do it if you haven't. If you need a recap for campaign two, we're doing our Critical Recap episodes now with our fantastic Dani Carr, who is doing succinct updates and reminders for things that have happened in the campaign, or if you've missed something and don't have the time and want to watch live, you can watch Critical Recap and be right ready to go when you’re here on Thursday.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right ready to go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Right ready.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Please come join those of us who will be here, and enjoy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My mom called me today, and she's like, “I'm watching you in the WonderCon panel.” I was like, oh no. What did I say? (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think your language was actually pretty good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We kind of had to. Yeah, on the back of the name cards, it says, “Please don't ever say bad words."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We still dropped a few.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. I mean, we're only human.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We do our best.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: True. Most of us. Except for Taliesin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The podcast of last week's episode, episode 11, is available for download, so if you listen to the show audibly or have friends who do, they can download it now, where finest podcasts can be downloaded. C2E2 is coming up! Not this weekend, but the weekend after, in Chicago. We're all going to be there. We have panels, signings, all of the information is up on the website now. You can find it on the Geek and Sundry Twitter or the Critical Role Twitter if you're wondering what is happening and where to go. We'd love to see you. Please come and be a part of the crazy convention. It's probably going to be pretty crazy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty big and there’s a lot of people going.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Chicago is a tiny town, though. There's not really a lot that's there. It's a couple trains or little puddle-jumper flights to get there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you pre-rolling your goddamn dice now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was one roll!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's true love, baby.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There was definitely more than one. It was at least two or three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're watching you like a hawk now, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Never again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, our fantastic friends at 826 and 826LA; they're a great charity. They do wonderful stuff for children in creative writing. Please go ahead and check out what they do, see if you can help support it or actually be a volunteer if a chapter is near you, so check it out. We love them and you should do so too. I don't think we have any new merch per se other than just the reminder, you have that wonderful shirt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, this shirt?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks good on you even when you're preggers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Even better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is our first maternity shirt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello and welcome back. Last we left off, the Mighty Nein had gotten in bed with a rebel group who had been meeting in the interior of Zadash. Unhappy with some members of the local government of this city, they had been trying to discover a way they could discredit some of the corrupt individuals that have been causing some strife in this city to some of the locals. You had met some of these individuals a few times to discover that there is an End of Harvest Gala that was arriving fairly soon. That was going to be a distraction period to allow them to infiltrate the abodes of two individuals in particular: Lord Sutan and the High-Richter Prucine. You discussed with them last time a plot, fixing their not-very-well-put-together plot into a better direction, thankfully.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all fucked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --to acquire a wax seal within the home of Lord Sutan to create a letter that you feel would be incriminating, then to infiltrate the High-Richter's home, do the same, and then report them to the lawmaster, or whoever else you'd think would be of higher estate. This is transpiring tomorrow evening. Where we last left off, it was later in the afternoon after your final discussion. You guys have a day to prepare however you wish to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A whole day?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, half a day, and then a whole other day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mighty Nein, what would you like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the lawmaster's name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Orentha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dayana Prucine

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the High-Richter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, Orentha.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where are we right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, you guys have just finished meeting with the other members of the Knights of Requital in--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: At the Song and Supper Inn

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Song and Supper, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Previously known as the Knights of Requital.

lines.name: EVERYBODY
lines.text: Right, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No longer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We’ve got to figure out where fucking Lord Sutan is, right? We don't have any eyes on that location.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think it might also be smart to see if we can drum up any type of handwriting samples for possibly both the Lord Sutan and the High-Richter, so we can more convincingly forge documents.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have Book Boy, too, he could probably tell if they're the same or not with his--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With his brain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With his brain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With his head.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. Well, the eyes in it, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, what did you say? I wasn't listening.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There was a spiderweb in the corner of the room and it's really pretty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're good at forging, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I am! Why do you ask?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have to get some handwriting samples, right? Of the Lord and the High-Richter, that way we can write letters, make it seem like they're--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I’m very good at writing letters.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where would we find something that's handwritten?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe on the job board at that place.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would that come from them, you think?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They might have some sort of edict written by Prucine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we didn't really check to see if they had signed any of them, did they?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We had them, would we have noticed if they were hand-signed or if they’d been printed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the job postings you had seen on the task board outside of the King's Hall, they were handwritten, but they all had been written by the Herald of the Hall. He was the one who was handling most of the jobs that were being distributed. Whatever information comes to him, he's the one who posts them, it seems.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I guess we we’ll just have to find a letter within their house, and then I can forge it right away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On the spot? How fast a forger are you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm a really quick thinker and I'm also a pretty fast writer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here, let's test you. I'm going to write down, (stammering) "Oh, what a goose I am." Copy my handwriting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was going to make you roll for it, but no, you got this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, I think we’re going to need you to both break in the house and also maybe into some safe that they have in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you're good at lockpicking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Will I be in there alone?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we’ll be with you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We will decide who goes in. I also want to discuss what exactly we are going to forge before we go in, because the plan that they laid out for us was not good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can say it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scheisse

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I’m drinking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, what was the last thing Caleb said?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I always listen to Caleb, he's my right-hand man.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did he say?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Poutine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That’s not what he said, but that is delicious and now I want some.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Follow me please, for a moment. We have to do our homework first, but after we do homework, we go to Sutan's, we find this seal, we hold onto it. We leave fake communication that you will write that is from the High-Richter, calling for a hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But how will we leave something from the High-Richter if I don't know actually what her handwriting looks like yet?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was thinking, do they have post here in this city? Someone that comes and picks up mail? Could we jack some of her fucking outgoing mail?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have stolen mail.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can do it again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're proficient in mail fraud.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am definitely proficient in mail fraud.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's later afternoon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's the exact time? No, I'm just kidding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't pull a Liam.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There would be a public record somewhere, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A public record of her handwriting?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, if she’s issued any sort of royal, official things, yeah, there should be some sort of record.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She is a judge after all, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And generally those public records tend to need to be open for--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: These are the most intense public officials I've ever attempted to swindle, so I'm not entirely sure what we do at this level.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I will say, worst case scenario, we don't necessarily need to match her handwriting, but some type of coding, potentially linked back to her. We can almost mimic it. People who are doing sneaky things never use their real handwriting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Leave a mark on a tree, etcetera. if you agree to these terms, and then we leave a mark on a tree, similar sort of thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. Maybe some accounts of the Myriad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A bag of gold in a trash receptacle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're leaving a bag of gold in a trash receptacle?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm saying that there's nothing to commit proof other than money actually exchanging hands. We used money for these things all the time back in my day. So if that letter asks for some sort of assurance or some sort of money to be placed: "Please hire a couple people, you can leave some money in this location for them," and if they find that money, then they know they actually consented and agreed to this whole argument.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is very complicated.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Extremely.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It isn't that complicated.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if we divide our forces for now and try to find that handwriting sample? One of us goes and looks for the post, the other one tries to find those public records.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if I go find the High-Richter and ask for her autograph?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like you'd be a fan?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know if Richters have fans.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, she was kind of unpleasant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, she wasn't really about that fan life.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did not care about your buttons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That’s right. She was vain.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The goal to be that we leave something in Sutan's house that would make it seem that the High-Richter has ordered a hit on Orentha and we leave something behind in Sutan's house: fake communications with the Myriad. So we tie Sutan to the Myriad, we tie Sutan to Richter, and then at Richter's house, we leave forged documents, we have a letter from Sutan with the seal, and also we leave communication with the Knights, whatsit--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So paranoid rich people are always paranoid rich people, right? So they always have these safes filled with documents.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yes, we had one of those at our house.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Were you guys paranoid?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (silence)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm baffled by the notion of building a box inside of a larger box inside of a larger box to hold papers, but fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Step one is: find documents. This is the most exciting thing we’ve ever done.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We also need to find where Lord Sutan lives.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! So find addresses

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! Cue the music.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet that the people in the Knights-- previously Knights-- they would know where Lord Sutan lives.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They might even have some sort of documentation or record. Remember Dolan was saying that they got ousted from their practice because of this Lord Sutan. Maybe they already have a paper trail.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't we know where Dolan lives?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We do. Nott tracked them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do. I saw their home? He lived--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yes. Harold? Horris.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, they will put out of businesses, if possible, they have some sort of paperwork that would come from the desk of the High-Richter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Possibly, but if we go by there, we can't be seen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can't be seen. We'd have to be in disguise, or one of us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or knock on the back door, if such a thing exists.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's start by talking to our friends before we start investigating our allies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Let's go that way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have any--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go get him, monk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's going to be really cool when I can do that. Really cool. Catch a fly. Anyway, moving on, that was me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we go to Dolan's house?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All of us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that how we want to find Lord Sutan's address?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe the Richter's handwriting, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wonder if we can track down Ulog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That seems like a good idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One thing at a time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's another thing-- and we can table this-- but there is also the possibility that this is all just a honey trap, and that we’re being drawn in for as big a fish than the Knights are themselves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You think we're big fish?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I think that they think they are looking for potentially big fish. I'm not saying that we are big fish. But we might be walking into a trap, so eyes on a swivel, is all I’m saying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So you're saying Ulog probably is in trouble and is going to roll over on us in order to get something taken off of him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Potentially, or any of them. Ulog seems the shiftiest, but that doesn't mean that he would necessarily be--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ulog’s probably listening to us right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To Dolan's, then.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All of us? All right, let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a single front door, it looks to be a two-chamber home, with one large central main living space and one bedroom in the back. The roof itself is made of heavily pressed-together thatch and stick. As soon as you approach, you can see that the front door is closed, and you see a little bit of movement through the window, someone walking around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who wants to go knocky-knocky?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We shouldn't be seen with them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you said there's no back door, right? Side windows, anything like that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I just saw a window and a door. Right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you saw, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, it should be one of the three of us, because that's who they'll know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You two have been speaking to them the longest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go do it, Fjord.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are a good talker, Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In disguise or as is?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there a little alley that I can pop into before I head over to his place of residence?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, two buildings over, you look off to the side and there's a small alcove of shade where you could probably pop in quickly and dispense a spell without it causing any ruckus.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I cast Disguise Self and I turn back into that-- black cloak with gold trim, the long black hair--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The same figure you brought to the High-Richter's?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I tie my robe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's all I've got.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't take a spell slot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're not going up there with him, right? Because he's in disguise now. You look the same, Beau.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, if you look like you--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I got that. Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't want to have them see us going over there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, well then you go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cool. All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Feel free to give me like a--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, what's the sign?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (screeching bird call)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, that's not it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A peacock?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought that was a hawk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (pigeon cooing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was that supposed to be a hawk? A pigeon? (pigeon cooing)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (pigeon cooing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough, it's a pigeon. A feral pigeon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll listen for the pigeon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A peacock is a fancy pet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are we signaling for?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If there's trouble.

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's a signal, we have one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I walk over to Dolan's house.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Knock on the door?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What happens if a pigeon goes by? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A flock of pigeons come down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (spell noises)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you knock on the door, there's a pause, and you see out of the corner of the window, the edge of a face peek out there, and then disappear behind, and a voice goes, "Who is it?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, it is-- I bring word from the Mighty Nein. May I come in, please?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear some rustling, some unlocking process, and the door opens up and you can see Horris opens the door and Dolan's behind. "Yes, please, come in." Looks just past you as you enter the building and they close the door behind you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there anyone in the room that I don't see besides Horris and Dolan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just the two of them at the moment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I see-- sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll drop the disguise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. They both pause for a second. "Oh, wow, all right, you are as skilled as they say, it seems. That's pretty useful."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: After we finished speaking, we realized we weren't aware of where Lord Sutan resided.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, right. His abode-- he lives in the Gilded Willows in the Tri-Spires."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Knew that much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Look for the three-story, iron-gated, dark greenwood building in that vicinity."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great. Will do. Another thing that we realized-- in our efforts to frame and forge, which are vast, you don't happen to have any handwriting from Lord Sutan, do you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, no, most lords are very careful with documentation transfer back and forth, they usually go through direct parcel services."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There was nothing that ousted you from your business, any sort of receipt, or--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, no. (chuckles) Nothing that was directly from his hand, at least. They usually go through intermediaries for that purpose."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there anyone else in the area that we should know that he does business with, that he might communicate with regularly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Somewhere in here. Oh, shit, it's my older notes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's a pen pal. And finding out who the pen pal is--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (pigeon cooing)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is really good all to know. Now we're getting all this information.

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: (as pigeons) High-Richter!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, there's no fucking pigeons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (as pigeon) High-Richter's handwriting!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I believe it's Ren Sutan."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ren Sutan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes." If not, the Internet will correct me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ren Sutan is his name?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's who he wrote to, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I thought Sutan was a title, like Lord Lord Lord.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, no, Lord Diedric Sutan is his name, Ren--"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's who he wrote to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ren is his son who he placed to destroy and take over our practice."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, he sounds like a real son of a bitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear Horris, off to the side, arms crossed now, hearing all this, goes, "Yeah, you could say that."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This Ren Sutan, any idea where we might be able to find him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both look at each other, and you watch as Dolan glances out the window. "Not that far outside of the Apple Tree Tutorship vicinity, you will find a white and peach building, with a few banners in the front, and that's Ren's new practice."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A physician also.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A dark physician, most likely, hmm?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Dark physicianry I guess is an issue in some parts of the world, I suppose?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, rampant where I'm from. Just real fucking dark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks back at Horris. Horris is like, "Right. Well, if you come across any dark physicianry, please do your best to quell it where it... seeds." (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Indeed I will. Indeed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You probably will not be hearing from us again before the task is done.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: (as pigeons) High-Richter!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (as pigeon) We need it more! High-Richter! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I keep trying to make a sound, it's just nothing's working.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was I supposed to say stuff about the High-Richter?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know, I'd say take the foot-in-mouth signal.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need the handwriting of the High-Richter more than Lord Sutan's handwriting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (exasperated sound) (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We blew it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck! (as pigeon) High-Richter!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (as pigeon) High-Richter!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you. We won't trouble you any longer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No worries. I suppose since-- Tomorrow evening, when everything's set to go, me and Horris, Kara, we're not going to be present when all of this goes down, so we have deniability when we turn our information in for this whole endeavor, but I think Ulog and you guys should meet on the outside of the tavern that we met at earlier today to kick this off."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Song and Supper Inn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You got it."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well good luck, and--"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (drawl) Mustard. Biscuits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (drawl) You're just a little feller, you oughtn’t talk like that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lock that door behind me, and I leave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Locks the door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How did it go?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you get the handwriting?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stupid pigeons.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Did you get the handwriting of the High-Richter?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord, we need it. Really bad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope, sorry, not going to help you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you not get it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did they say, though?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A whole bunch of stuff, but I can't say it around them, I just won’t, out of principle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. All right. Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but actually do you think you could go back and say that you forgot to ask a question?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just say, hey, the whole point of this was to find the High-Richter's handwriting as well, and maybe--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I understand that these two are really busting your balls, and I commiserate with that, but we do need in fact to ask.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Knock-knock-knock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The eye peeks through the window once again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One more thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (door opening)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm keeping an eye out for anyone watching.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Totally forgot to ask, you don't happen to have any handwriting from the High-Richter do you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, that would make this a lot easier."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Have a good day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You too." (door closing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. None.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, well, we checked that box off, so now we have to get to work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We got some good information, we got Sutan's address and Ren's address.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Blah blah blah, Ren's address and the address. Now you got it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, and it's super interesting--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa, that is really good, Fjord, you did a really good job in there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also super interesting that they mentioned having other people do their work for them. (pause) Okay, let's go!

lines.text: Was that mentioned?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He said they have other people do parcel service and stuff for him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, okay, yeah, that. Blah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you're saying that we could use other handwriting as well, and it wouldn't be out of the ordinary, as long as it beared the signature and seal of said place?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well maybe not even a signature. Most people trying to be smart about not getting caught aren't probably like my name and social security number.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we get some parchment that says from the home office of Lord Sutan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, a letterhead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want stationery, sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Beyond actual, personal stationery. I think the notion would be is that you would actually send your actual handwriting in something like this because that way they would know that it was you. You would be very careful how and who you would send that through. You wouldn't want a second person taking dictation as you plotted to overthrow the government.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay well how about this, I think the seal is going to be good; I think any type of money amount mentioned in any of the letters and then we cross that and leave that type of amount of gold in the-- like there's been a money hand off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're getting ahead of ourselves. Let's stay on task. Let's head to the Gilded Willows where in the Tri-Spire, where the fucking Scottsdale party-- What do these notes say, Skyskate Park and Constellation Boulevard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Knotts Berry Farm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Constellation Bridge.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah that thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Constellation Bridge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Constellation Bridge tower and Skyscape Park.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I was writing real fast.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's good there's a bathroom on the way to that. That works out well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we're going there with the express purpose of--?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just recon. We're trying to see what this place looks like, if we can see Lord Sutan. Then we'll make a decision if we go after his son or not. Who maybe has some of his handwriting.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's in the Tri-Spire. So we need to go through the sewers to get there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe a birthday card.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or we can go up, a few of us, through the actual front gates and then meet up with everyone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, well how about half of us go to Lord Sutan's and half of us go check out Ren's.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are we looking for at Ren's?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Handwriting.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, from his papa.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And see if Ren's a son of a bitch. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go to check out Ren.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah me too, because I can't make it through the gates.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think anyone can make it through the gates, except for you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I was wondering what you were talking about.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought we were going to take the sewer to get in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought Beau might be able to get through the gates, actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could get through the gate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Because she's got a cloak now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah and it's not a magical disguise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go check out-- yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Caleb, where you want to go buddy?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will go to Sutan's.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, they're both Sutan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, the elder, I'm sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Will you be able to get in?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not without you. You'll come with me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll sneak on in through the sewers?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well how do you want to do it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're talking about going straight in through the gate because they're, you know, respectable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (distraught) Well it's such a thing to get into the sewers. We have to make a distraction and everything, every time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perhaps we should just have a two person reconnaissance for now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can manage ourselves.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, we won't get into any trouble.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you won't bring back Clarota or nothing, it'll be great.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We know our way around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Too soon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can't be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We got this, let's go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we meet back at the Song & Supper Inn at what, sunset?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or just at the Leaky Tap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got maybe an hour and half to two hours before sunset.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's just meet back at the Leaky Tap.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, fair enough.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: At the Leaky--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Leaky or the Song & Supper? We're talking about two different-- Leaky Tap.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Leaky Tap.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hour and a half, all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Break.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Woo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you make your way towards the front entry gates there, one of the guards posted there is familiar with you and begins to let you through. As you approach--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I flip it to the blue side, cobalt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pass through, a few steps behind Jester, the guard approaches, “Halt. I don't believe I've seen you through here before."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh I'm--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She came through earlier. She's with me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Literally like 24 hours ago.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the massive tree-tops that fill out the skyline from your perspective. Every home seems to have a row of greenery between. It's a very, very beautiful neighborhood. You can follow where the Constellation Bridge Tower as a beacon and as it guides you towards its area it doesn't take long for you to see the large, gaudy, three-story complex that is Lord Sutan's home. You can see the gold leaf carving along the edges of each of the various stories in between. The dark green slats that are there, are coated in some sort of a lacquer material that almost glistens in the sunlight as it passes. The sunset colors now starting to make their way into the cloud-covered sky. You do see marble pillars at the corner of the estate's grounds. With iron gates that link each of them, with about maybe five foot bit of simple lawn-hill that separates the gap between the gate and the building itself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are the gates chained shut or does it look like there's a lever?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well the gates on all them are solid except for in the very front and the very back. Both of them appear to be closed and locked. You do see, posted at the front of the front door, there are two crownsguard that are there keeping watch. On the back end as you case around to the rear side of the home, there is a singular crownsguard and a dog that is on a chain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two in front. Does it look like there's any blind spots, any trees that go up and cusp over the walls?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hashtag NBC Blindspot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not good. Eleven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to see where any perspective would be a blind spot. For entry, other than above or from the sides because the front and back seem pretty well covered by these guards, as they're currently posted and standing there. So the only things that really make sense would be either flanking the building or something that guides you over top. That's all you can think of.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How high are the buildings next to the house?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that is immediately to the left of it is two-story, it's a shorter building. There is a tree to the immediate right of it that rises up to about the height, if not a little taller, than the actual home itself. The building next to it is another two stories. This one lords over the other buildings, but there is one large tree that is about five feet from the edge of the wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. That seems usable.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a big jump but we can do it. It's not too big.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like a five feet jump?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's doable, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: From, like a swinging branch?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: From rooftop to wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's five feet to the wall, and then about five feet from the wall to the actual building. So it's a ten foot from the tree to the roof.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Could you parkour the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could certainly try.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was what I was thinking, wall to wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Monk shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I knew you were already there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do they look like one of the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gate's about eight feet tall and the building is three stories. So I mean there are some roof-edge perches the stories kinda taper with each additional floor. So there is a small space, maybe a foot, a foot and a half wide that you could shoot for. If there was something you wanted to try but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there windows on that side of the house?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Though they are currently closed. Those are on the two side edges of the building.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a balcony connected to them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. There's no balcony.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No balcony. So there appear to be--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The only balcony you saw was in the large balcony at the front of the High-Richter's home, but not on this one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No balcony, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So a few guards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A dog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A dog, I like dogs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love dogs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a double-cellar door that descends beneath. That is what is currently being guarded with a man and the dog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I wonder if anything would lure the guards away from the house.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, maybe a drunk. A drunkard trying to break in somewhere else?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, a public disturbance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe a drunk trying to talk to them in the front of the house or something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or in the back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean our group is pretty good at causing distractions.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They can do that. That's totally-

lines.text: Some people jump up and over?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. It's going to have to go fast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Oh man. Maybe we could get some rope and a grapple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah we could do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could throw a grapple for ten feet, I know that.

lines.text: Do I have a climber's kit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you have a climber's kit?

lines.text: I don't have a climber's kit, but we can go buy a climber's kit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can go get a climber's kit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.text: Guys, let's challenge ourselves. We have to break in, only using ball bearings.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How do we do it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The new D&D nightmare mode.

lines.text: (shiftily) You need some some ball bearings man?

lines.text: You're all level one bards with nothing but ball bearings, go.

lines.text: We did a good job scouting this place out and stuff.

lines.text: Unfortunately--

lines.name: MARISHA

lines.text: Well the wall is an iron gate. They're all long, iron fencing gate. There are the marble pillars at the corner of each one. So it's open, it's a series of bars.

lines.text: Oh.

lines.text: Okay.

lines.text: (vaporized noise)

lines.text: Game over.

lines.text: Oh no.

lines.text: You know, when I used to hop fences back where I came from--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm?

lines.text: Where was that?

lines.text: You're not there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you're ever trying to get over barbed-wire or any pointy fences, you take a rug or a bedroll, and you throw it over there, and you hop over and you--

lines.text: That's personal Marisha experience isn't it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah I mean--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's some Fight Club shit.

lines.name: MARISHA

The building itself seems fairly well made, there's elements of a plaster material put against the wood to make it seem a little less cracked and broken on the vicinity around it. It looks like a little more money went into this complex than a lot of the surrounding buildings.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Frumpkin curls up and jumps onto the windowsill, and you glance through the vision of your familiar. The first window you come across, inside, it's a simple room, it’s painted a similar white, peach color. There's a single bed, maybe twin size, with a single sheet. You see an individual who is currently lying on it, with not quite Caleb dirty clothes, but not an upperclassman by any means. Upperclassman? Not what I was going for, that's fine.

They're sick with something pretty bad, and there is a person inside that is dressed in a white robe that is in the process of bringing them both broth, but they have a mask over their face, a piece of cloth tied behind, and it looks like they're treating some diseased patients. This is, for all intents and purposes, an infirmary.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 11 strength. Okay… Oof!

lines.name: LIAM

lines.text: All right. So the two of you enter. You go through the front door. It's a double door. It pushes open. It doesn't appear to have resistance, it's on a hinge. You push in, and at the front there's a clerk there, wearing the same white robe: a middle-aged man, receding hairline, short hair, big bulbous red nose, some pock-marking on his cheek. He looks up. "Can I help you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm fine. I'm perfectly, perfectly fine. I don't need to do any of this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm fine!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you're doing that, I need you to roll a deception check with advantage because you're helping.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Magnets, how the fuck do they work? That's nice. 21.

lines.name: TALIESIN

I'm giving myself a good cut, maybe there'll be a little ice fleck. I don't know if I want to activate that, if it'll work on my fingernails, but what the fuck. I'm going to start crawling, leaving a trail of vomit into the next room, going, no! No!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yup.

lines.text: The clerk at this point goes, "Please! Stay tight, I'm going to-- shit!" He leaves the room.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go, go, go, go!

lines.name: LIAM

lines.text: You walk in as you see there's a spray of stuff across the clerk's counter. You see both Mollymauk and Fjord crawling in opposite directions across the floor as you hear footsteps, and the clerk had just rushed out of the chamber down the hallway.

lines.text: There's one to each side as you enter. Where the clerk's desk was, it looks like there's all the rooms you saw on the right side, all the rooms you saw on the left side, and there are chambers in the center of the building with the two hallways that bisect the two areas. You can choose right or left, it's up to you. The clerk went down the right side.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you're rushing with Nott in your arms, you head into the hallway on the left side and you glance and can immediately see another person with a robe, who is holding a small satchel of some sort of greenish material. They walk and see you. "Excuse me, can I help you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (crying)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (baby wails)

lines.text: Make a deception check, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, no, me? That's a negative one. (shriek)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What seems to be the problem?" He looks, as opposed to being empathically interested in your well-being, is genuinely disturbed by the sound the child is making, Rosemary's Baby style.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin appears on the back of the guy's neck and starts tearing in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, God, you're using it to attack? You can do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an attack for Frumpkin, please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My allergies are going to be shit in about five seconds. My worst nightmare.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, my gosh, for a cat? I mean, it's a 13 plus I don't know what.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits, he's wearing a robe. Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Starts clawing. One?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He starts screaming and grabs Frumpkin on his back and tries to pull him and throw him off. Frumpkin full-on spins, scatters, all claws and legs out, lands on the ground. (Angry cat sound) Full puff-up, tail and everything. At this point you watch another doorway flip open, and you see a man come out with very short brown hair on the sides with a pompadour in the front and a similar white robe, but it looks like it's longer-sleeved with more detail. He goes, "What is all this ruckus happening?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, I hate him. I hate him already.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What is a cat doing here? Get the cat!" He watches as the clerk says, "I don't -- shoo! Shoo! Shoo!" He's trying to get Frumpkin to leave now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Off in the distance you hear, You have no legal authority over me! (vomit)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (hacking cough)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's now other workers of the infirmary coming out of the rooms that are all starting to gather. The one who saw you in the hallway is now coming towards you while shooing Frumpkin out. You watch the guy who had left the chamber head back into the office and close it. People are starting to scatter. You guys are waiting in the two rooms now, you said? You found two separate rooms?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just running the hall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're just running the hall?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm crawling in the hall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm standing there like (hacking cough). I think I shit my pants!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're coughing loud in the room. You're crawling in the hall. Behind them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there enough chaos for us to step into one of these open rooms and shut the door behind us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll find out in a second. Now we have you spitting and freaking out. The two clerks that are trying to push Frumpkin out are trying to escort you. They see you. They're like, “Sir? Sir?” They start grabbing your arms and lifting you up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (vomit) I'm still bleeding from the neck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They start dragging you into one of the rooms on the side. They open one room and there's somebody in there already who was sleeping but is starting to come to, going, "What's happening?" "Sorry!" They close the door, go to the next chamber, and start dragging you into an empty room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to immediately -- I'm going to go limp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then the minute the door's open, I'm going to make a break for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. They open the door--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm out!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You bolt?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to bolt. Full speed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an athletics check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. Athletics or acrobatics? Athletics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, this would be your choice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yay. That's nice. Nine?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Nine!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've probably had patients try and make big physical actions while they're in their care, and they hold you back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's magic! I'm possessed! I turn to one and go, (in a guttural voice) The power of Christ compels you! I'm going to use Devil's Tongue and I'm going to do a couple points of damage to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Devil's Tongue or Vicious Mockery?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vicious Mockery.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, lord. Oh no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's only a couple points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That's 11. What's your DC on it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: On Vicious Mockery? Where's my -- I'm not used to magic. It's so weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'd like to say, I feel pretty good about our casing mission.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your charisma modifier?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Charisma modifier is zero.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your modifier's right there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it? I'm blind. Where does it go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine. They succeed. You shout this and one of them (groan). They grab and throw you into the room. You (whoosh) into the chamber and they close the door, pushing you inside of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It would've been a plus three modifier, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, what's the DC of the spell is what I'm asking?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm trying to find that. I'm not used to magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They close the door. You land on the ground and you hear it lock behind you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are now a dangerous patient who needs other glancing. While that's happening and they're distracted by that, you guys--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look for an empty room. Or is every room in the house full?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say about half of them are full. You see two chambers that are empty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I go in and shut the door behind us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You close the door. You guys both make stealth checks real fast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are we doing in here? We have to go back to the office!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but he's in the office.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could -- You're right. Maybe we should just leave. Molly and Fjord will be fine, we'll just leave.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don't know. That's a no, we're working together. We're trying to work together with people. No, we have to get all of us out of here, which is more important than finding this asshole in the building. What do we do, what do we do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have some-- We could-- I'm looking. What do we got? We could do Enemy of My Enemy?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That seems extreme at this moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could-- I don't know what to do!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (knocking) "Hello? Is there somebody in here?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He walks over.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's go. Out we go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, let's go! We're going to run out the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, wait! Wait!" You guys bolt past into the hallway. You guys dart out to the entrance and out into the night air.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, out of the hospital or just out of the room?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wasn't saying that, but I don't mind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just out of the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, just out of the room. You guys are out of the room and the person sees you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but we'll go down the hall towards the front of the building to look for, I would assume, Fjord and Molly at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you guys find Fjord there, coughing loudly, while you are currently locked in this room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. Is there a window?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In the door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Well, no. There's a door, it's a closed solid door, and there's a window looking outside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (cackling) Are there bars on the window?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's not. No. There is one cross bar that is maintained, it's more to support the four panes of glass, but that's it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. I'm going to peek out the door to see if anybody's coming for a minute.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Peek out the door?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean the little door window.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry, there's no window in the door.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No window in the door and the door is locked. Okay. I'm going to start gently meditating on breaking the window, or opening the window if it'll open.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. While you're meditating on that--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is Fjord alone in this room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord is alone in the room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I turn and show him Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We got to go!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you get anything?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well don't give up! (cough) I walk out towards them. Do you have a privy? I think I shat myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We've brought the doctor." He moves before the doctor, who approaches. "All right, so you appear to be sick."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. (cough) I have a terrible cough and apparently my breakfast didn't agree with me and I coughed a little too much and felt a pack in my pants.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is this the doctor that we saw before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16? He goes, "All right. Please have a seat in this chamber."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think I got shit in my pants. Can I visit the bathroom real quick? I don't want it running down my thighs and stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's an outhouse about two blocks down outside. Come back -- "

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't have anything in the building?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Get in the room. We'll get you a pan."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. Yeah. I go in the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go in the room, and one of them pulls out a metallic bedpan and sets it down on the side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I have a little privacy while I check my undercarriage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What’s your problem?”

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (soft voice) Fever. She has a fever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: “Let me see her.” He comes forward and puts his hands out towards Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (hisses)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you do that? Make an intimidation check with advantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Intimidation? Negative three?! How is that possible? 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. The physician goes (screams), falls back. The other two clerks or physician helpers catch him: “Get it out! Get it out! Out! Shoo!”

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I’m going to scamper towards the office if I can, as fast as I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an acrobatics check to try and dodge past their grasp as you begin to dart through their--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god. Nine? They got me. They got me, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you run, all of a sudden there’s a tug on your cloak and the same younger physician who had told you to get out is clutching the back of your cloak and lifts you up off the ground. “Well then, someone’s going to play nice with the Crownsguard,” and turns and starts bringing you towards the exit. “You too, outside!”

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no. This couldn’t have gone better.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Am I in the room by myself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I cast Disguise Self and give myself the same sort of clerk/orderly outfit as…

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, easily.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe not looking exactly like one of them, but like them in a uniform.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay. Can I exit the room and come out into the hall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You exit out and the two other ones are looking a bit confused. He’s currently dragging Nott who’s flailing on the edge of the cloak, dangling, out into the main area.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Get him out of here. I walk past them, towards the office where the doctor is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. He goes and throws you out onto the street. Pushes you out, Caleb, and goes “Guard!” and begins pointing loudly over there, down in the direction of where you tumbled and landed on the ground.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, so who’s where outside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys got shoved out into the front of the facility. Nott got tossed, landed, and stumbled a few feet, and they’re now shouting for the guard and pointing at Nott.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pointing at us? Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Enemy of My Enemy now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (groans) That still seems extreme. We should just book it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you fast? All right, fine. I’m not leaving you. I’m much faster than you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys start bolting?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We’re going to start to run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys run, they don’t give chase because it’s not their job to do so, but they start shouting and shouting. I want you both to roll stealth checks to try and see if you can avoid the sight of the Crownsguard that are in the process of responding to the shout.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 15 from me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Only a ten for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys dart into the nearby shadows, plugging down a few alleyways, you hear some voices in the distance, some conversations, some shouting, and then some footfalls that get loud... and then get a little softer, and eventually a little softer and fade off. You just barely scraped by on that one.

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You, however, darted off towards the open office and as soon as you glance in there, you can see there is a desk set up, there is a chair, there are a number of large books and stacks of parchment. It looks like there is a whole rack up top with various medicinal herbs and salves that are categorized into small makeshift cubbies. This is where a lot of the treatment seems to be mustered.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I turn, and as I start to close the door behind me, can I look down the hallway and see if anybody is walking towards me in the hallway. Is it relatively clear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it’s clear for the moment, but the man who was just in this office just finished throwing Nott outside and is in the process of talking with the Crownsguard. You don’t know how long you have until he returns.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I grab a handful of papers off the desk and put them under my shirt and start walking out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You palm a bunch and throw it in there, all right. You exit, just as you see them returning to the hallway with the physician straightening his outfit, making his way in your direction. Doesn’t even make eye contact with you, just brushes by and shoulder-checks you, which is hilarious because the size of your visual is much smaller, so it’s like (impact) “Watch it!” and was two inches away, but doesn’t seem to notice in the moment that he actually did so. Makes his way into the office, you hear the door close behind you, and the two other clerks frustratingly start scattering and making their way to the other chambers. One of them is talking to the other about, “I don’t know what happened. He went crazy and started spitting and was bleeding everywhere,” and they’re both making their way to the door where Molly is in.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was very unruly; I need to excuse myself for a moment. I’ll head out of the infirmary.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You head back out onto the street. You are in that chamber for a while. Are you doing anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How long has it been?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I’m heading out of the infirmary and I’m going to start wrapping around the building towards the side of the building that he was in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I’m seeing how-- is it possible to open the window?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: God, all these numbers I used to be good at, but I’m not good at anymore. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten. Nothing easily does so. You can try and pry one of the panes out, but there’s a decent chance it might break in the process if you’re not careful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That’s fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You’re going to try? You take one of your blades and you wedge it up underneath where the metal bar is, it’s holding the pane in place to see if you can wedge it out. Go ahead and make a straight dexterity check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope. One.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It shatters and breaks on both sides of the window. You watch as the window shatters outward--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I’m going to jump out of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The pane itself is about that big, so you’re going to take more of the window with you to do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, that’s okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right! You shoulder-roll-leap through, shattering the window out of the infirmary, rolling into the alley. You see this happen as Molly is a chaotic spill of glass shards and purple skin.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Run!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys bolt. At this point, as you head back, you’ve now seen the guards that have just run off to go after Nott hear the shatter and turn around to begin, some of them, to double back to where the sound of the glass breaking came from.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I point off in a different direction than Molly’s running, since I look like a hospital clerk nurse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Carry me. I’m going to jump into your arms while you do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no, he’s pointing the other direction!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It’s too late!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, no, I’m trying to understand the scene here. I thought they were looking at him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They’re looking at him, but you were running away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, if I’m already-- because I didn’t know if I was just standing--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15. The guards approach and they both look antsy, but they see you pointing away, and they both head in the direction that you were heading them off towards, as Molly’s about to leap into your arms.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was already-- towards…

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have managed to find yourselves back into the chaotic evening of the streets of Zadash.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think I was imagining a small mom-and-pop place with two physicians, but like 50 people in white coats came out--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It’s like six.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think it was more like 72, Matt, let’s be honest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In the meantime, me and Jester are like: What’s taking them so long?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that only took five minutes to go that bad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He took an hour to cosplay his dick!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is still there, by the way!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know, I’m going to save that for later.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As we’re walking back, can I start looking over the papers, looking for some sort of signature that says Richter or Prucine or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. As you guys make your way back to the Leaky Tap to eventually meet up, going through the paperwork, unfortunately, none of them have anything that signifies the High-Richter. They all seem to be various quick notes on bones breaks and resets, on various illnesses that have come through and treatments that have been applied, keeping tabs on return visits. It’s all various notes of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anything from his dad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing from Lord Sutan, unfortunately.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it was just on top of the desk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you had possibly searched a little longer, you could have maybe found something, you think, but given the circumstances, it did not occur.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Crown of Madness!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you didn’t find anything you wanted to, and you probably definitely fucked up a few people’s recovery routine. But that’s fine. You guys eventually find your way back to The Leaky Tap. Your monk and your cleric are waiting for you, and you watch as these four individuals walk in looking a bit haggard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great success. Went off without a hitch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why are you covered in mayonnaise and egg?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why do you smell like beer?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And hot sauce? Is that hot sauce?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is, in fact, hot sauce. I’m going to empty out my canteen into the fire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gross.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was making a distraction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We found Ren. We--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He’s heavily guarded. There was no way to get close enough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you go in and say “Can I speak to Ren?” and then somebody else go in his office while somebody was in the front asking to talk to Ren?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That’s actually exactly what happened, it just didn’t go as well as you thought it might go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great minds think alike, though, Jester.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fools seldom differ.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You look

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We almost had to kill an orderly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It’s very embarrassing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That’s true, it came very close.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How’d it go for you two?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well, we cased out his house. We found a big tree that we can hop the fence with. Oh, and we bought this rope and this grapple so that we can climb.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you looked at the house and then you went shopping?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, so that we can break into the house, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tight, that’s tight.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I jumped through a window.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You what?!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Full glass, it was great.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that what all of these things are?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, some of those are sequins, but yes, essentially.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was a good dry run for our real heist that we’re going to be doing in a day. So we’re working out the kinks…

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not promising.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It’s not about the plan, it’s about the desire to improvise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Cure Wounds on Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yay. I had very little, so thank you for that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know this could lead back to make it look suspicious if we go after Lord Sutan if his son was just broken into, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, don’t worry about that because they definitely saw our real faces.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not my face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yes, you’re right. They only saw my real face, so maybe that’s okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He’s going to know his medical notes are missing, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It’s an infirmary. They got to see terrible people in there all the time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, agreed. In hospitals, you see all nature of people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, nobody mentioned anything about needing handwriting, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, there was not a lot of--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No talk of his father at all, right--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There was not a lot of talking, in fact.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was probably just an attempt to steal medicinals.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure, sure. All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we have Ren’s handwriting. We could potentially put a note in somebody’s house with his stuff, but I don’t know if that’s what the plan is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I mean, that works because as Dolan said, these fancy people tend to get other people to write their mail and do their paperwork for them, so…

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it could add credibility to the tapestry that we’re trying to weave here. The goal is still to get into Sutan elder’s home and get this seal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that never changed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Within the writings that we forge we could include some by the junior Sutan, so that would add some credibility to what we’re doing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Might get us in past that outer wall, at least.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We still have to figure out what we are going to-- if we are starting at Sutan’s house, then… We don’t have any writing of the High-Richter’s; we are either trying to focus on finding that somehow or, going on what you were discussing which is creating the appearance of an underling, or a for-hire of the High-Richter’s, or some kind of code saying that they are communicating with Sutan elder on behalf of the High-Richter, yeah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, over here, knows a little bit of Thieves’ Cant.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you need me to write something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It would look shifty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could do that--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I’m just saying, from my experience, normally if you’re trying to do a coup--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Experience as a what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As a rebellious teenage woman. In my experience, normally if you’re trying to do something bad, you’re not like “Dear diary, I did this bad thing. Signed, Beauregard.” You get what I’m putting down?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it’d be obvious.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Correct. We want to look-- if it’s too obvious, it’s the opposite of convincing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sign it somebody else’s name.

lines.name: MARISHA
