lines.text: This guy goes by The Gentleman because he is smart. That’s all I’m saying.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We want to put information in Sutan’s house-- elder-- right? We could have some sort of writing that is not from the High-Richter, but that says “H-R would prefer the plans to go into motion--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: “H-R wants a meeting with you.”

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: “Spoke to The Myriad,” yeah…

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: “Finalized the plans.”

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I propose that we make it seem like Sutan and the High-Richter were conspiring to have Orentha killed. So we have a note put into Sutan’s house that says: “On behalf--” from an intermediary, “On behalf of HR, wants the plan to go into motion immediately and that Orentha will be out for the festival tonight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Big O. We should say Big O.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Big O. That is good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then we plant that in Sutan elder’s house when we successfully, quietly break in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I’ll start writing that note right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In block letters? Can’t be traced to anyone? That sort of thing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it’s an intermediary, so does not have to look--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It doesn’t really matter.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I’ll make it look crisp and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Make it look like evil calligraphy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, like evil handwriting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This letter perhaps on its own is not enough, but with the seal, if we have a matching letter planted in HR’s home--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Got your messages. I will move the meeting up and the Big O is going to die for sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And a little bribery if we’re trying to go for something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But where are we going to get this money you keep talking about?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can just promise them money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here’s the thing, having seen people be bribed before: you need very large sums of money for bribing. Especially with rich people. They’re not going to need 500 gold to do this sort of thing, they want 5000 gold for this sort of thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It depends. If you’re just handing money off to an assassin. If it’s a lowly level person, might not need much. Doesn’t need to be the whole amount. Just needs to be a payment, maybe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A check?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A check? An IOU. “On behalf of HR-- “

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keep your writing very plain. Not immensely charming--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Traceable!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I mean not charming, like the way you speak.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So no hearts above the i’s then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I write, “On behalf of HR-- “

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that’s good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What comes after that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Big O thing. The plan against the Big O.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: “HR would like the plan to be moved forward.”

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: “It will commence-- “

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: “As discussed.”

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: “Commence as discussed.”

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sounds official.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: “On behalf of HR, the plan-- “

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: “The plan is moving up to tomorrow night, at the festival.”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: “The plan is moving up to tomorrow night, at the festival.”

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: “The moment has come, and it is time for us to seize it.”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That’s what I write.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You work out the logistics of that letter--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And it sounds super boss.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: “Yours truly, forever and ever, your BFF-- “

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Take out the part where you say, “Do you like me? If so, check this box.” (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought that tied the whole thing together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I thought it was good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And no perfume on the letter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aw, you beat me to it! No signing it with a kiss.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just a simple--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What kind of dog?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What kind of dog?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait! Should I fold it or should I scroll it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Scroll it! Because we’re going to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The guard dog that was outside of the home?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There’s a guard dog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was a mastiff.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was a mastiff? Was it a well-kept dog or-- was it a dog of pride or just a dog of--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you guys saw of the mastiff, it wasn’t a show dog by any means, but it wasn’t a street dog they’re just using for the moment.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Was it a talking mastiff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One way to find out!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it look like the sort of dog that you can actually be proud of or is it just a utility?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like it’s a utility dog. You’ve seen some dogs go around with members of the crownsguard before as part of the general-- It’s more for an intimidation tactic. They’re rarely ever utilized, but the presence of a dog just make some people, especially those who work in darker categories, unsettled.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have a cat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can the cat become a mastiff?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can the cat get the dog--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To chase it away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then someone would have to get the dog back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just shoot the dog with an arrow and kill it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I’m just talking about getting the dog-- no!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Somebody’s going to have to retrieve the dog if the dog goes running.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here’s the deal, Nott--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We don’t want a dead dog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. we need to leave no trace. The only way this gets pulled off is if--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is the subtle one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ever.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Show the dog your dick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I’m not showing anybody-- there’s no more of that. What if the dog runs? The guard will have to get the dog back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They’ll chase after the dog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Frumpkin can do that very well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can try that. If it doesn’t work, then we try to jump up and over.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, sausages are very inexpensive, so we have that as a Plan B.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We also have good ol’ Fjord, who can always disguise himself as a guard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And relieve him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Say that somebody really wants him over at the party.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they private guards, though, or are they crownsguard?

lines.name: MARISHA, MATT
lines.text: They were crownsguard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They were assigned.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know what, Nott, if you want-- one idea, if you want to help, is you can also write a note in your Thieves’ Cant. It should be vague on details, but a message from the Myriad. Or don’t even get that specific, but write, in Thieves’ Cant, a note saying that everything is in place for the festival.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think that’s a good idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Sure. I need a few papers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A few papers are always good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you guys work your way through preparing this letter, condensing your plots for the next evening, and eventually find yourself to a night’s rest in preparation for the next day’s events, we’re going to take a break!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but I think we should go back to the hospital one more time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Fucking D&D.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Watching your face, Matt, as all that was happening. You were like, what are they doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those are my favorite moments of the game! I’m like, I don’t-- okay, guys! This is happening! This is all your fault.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was a great plan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You need to be in the Twitch chat room to participate. Right now, the offer's only good for residents of the United States and Canada, excluding Quebec, because, apparently, Quebec. For the official rules, you can find the link in the chat tonight, but tonight it is the Flame Box Elder Deck Box, which is pretty awesome. Oh, and it came with a Magic pack with a guy going (screams)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is he at the hospital?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why is there a Magic pack in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Denoba will get your information in the chat if he hasn't already, and we'll get that to you, so congratulations. So, as you guys all prepare for the evening’s rest, the next day-- is there anything you needed to do before the next day happens?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would like to talk to Caleb. (clears throat) Oh, Caleb? Nott here. I have a favor to ask of you. I absconded with some items recently, and I wanted you to take a look at them with your keen eye.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where did you get these items?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was not-- I didn’t break in anywhere-- I mean, we did, but it was cool because other people were with me. It’s when we went down into the basement to scout around for other entrances into the bottom of the Leaky Tap.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Under the Leaky Tap? And you found?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I found a skeleton that had these bracelets on her? Him? They?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You found a skeleton?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I don't know. I didn't really have time to look at it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You found a dead person?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A very old dead person. Could be ancient.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but it's not really typical to keep a dead-- like a skeleton in your basement.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't think about that, but yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nor in your closet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that's a topic for the group. We're staying in an inn where there was a dead person.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think it's haunted or anything. It just seemed like someone-- it was stuffed way in the corner behind some boxes like someone wanted to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's worse. That's not better, that's worse.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, well, that's somewhat unsettling, but show me these items that you have.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: These are just bracelets that I found. I was wondering if you could use your magic skills.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I place them down on the bed and go through the process of casting Identify on them. It takes about ten minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you finish the focus, you glance down at them, extending your consciousness to see if there's any residual magic energy. They're not enchanted, but they are made of a very nice, solid platinum with a gold spiral lay on them, once you pull the dust off, so they’re probably worth a little bit of money.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You should sell these. These are not little and adorable like buttons.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, but they're shiny and nice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want to wear them?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh. Maybe I could.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you could. What--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are they big?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they huge for a goblin’s little wrists?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks like they're more-- they may have been made for a more masculine figure’s wrists probably, or a thick-armed lass.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe your ankle or calf, you could put them on. Or sell them and then you could put them to use.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm still a little disturbed that there's a dead person under this inn that we're in right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I understand. Well, we can go back and I can show you, if you'd like, but it didn't seem like--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I take your word for it, that it's there. I don't need to go poking about.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do you do that? Where you look at something and you just see what it is?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it is a spell that I learned when I was--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's so cool! It's very impressive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You could potentially learn this as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course! If you apply yourself--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. You know so many spells and so many things. You're very strong. I'm continually impressed by you, I must say. How strong would you say you are? On a scale of one to 20?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I do have things that I want to do with my life, and I mean to apply myself and study, and find knowledge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that the way you'll get even stronger? Through study and books?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would magical items help further your abilities or blessings?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That seems like an abstract question. There are certainly very useful things that can be found in this world. You never know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm fine, I'm just fascinated by all things wizard and I want you to succeed, that's all. I have great faith in you, I know you'll do great things, and I just want to help you get there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, thank you, friend.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Yes. Anything, anything to help the cause.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, maybe we go to bed and tomorrow we don't tear the roof down off of every building we go into again, yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Sounds good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I take out my silver thread and I start casting the Alarm spell on our room before bed, and then I go to bed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Anybody else have anything to do before the evening's rest, or are you happy to continue the next day?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Next day for me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shouting) Pillow fight!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau gets a little too aggressive with the pillow fight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ow, okay. We're done.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mess with the bull, get the horns.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so, as the evening comes to a close, the next morning greets you on a somewhat chilled, misty morning, the sky gray, but the light is out. You can see a faint mist is burning off of the streets in the early morning, like six or seven-ish. You all gather yourselves. Is there anything you wish to accomplish during the day, or do you wish to jump ahead to the meeting of the afternoon, the evening?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should we get some awesome all-black clothes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should so that we stealth better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, something a little bit more stealthy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can put it in the pink bag.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I like that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was thinking some carnival masks, from the other direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, all black looks like you're up to no good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and if you are actually in the dark, you can't tell the difference, and if you're in the light you look like a ninja, so I think we're good, maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I see what you're saying. Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everyone’s going to be pretty fancy-dressed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The carnival is going on today?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the festival is happening this evening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we know anything about this festival, like, culturally? Do they wear masks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, the harvest is celebrated at different points, and in a few weeks is the official Harvest End festival. This is done in advance, it's more of a private event that is for the more elite. Some folks come in from out of town, from local smaller townships that are pretty well off and trying to rub elbows with the local elite. It's a festival that contains food, music, drink. You've never been to one, of course, and you've heard of it from the time you spent in Zadash. You've never seen it, but you've seen folks take care through the street towards the event, and it seems to be fairly like a more subdued Mardi Gras colors, but the colors are more reds and browns and golds. They have masks they'll wear for it, but they aren't full face, just habitual eye masks. Only some will, some folks don't get fully into the spirit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we should go shopping.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Masks on sticks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Masks on sticks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we're not actually going to the fancy gala, so we probably don't need the fancy stuff, because it's just for the rich people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But will it get us through the gate?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I figure for all of us to get in, we should go through the sewers, probably.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If someone stops you, if you have a mask, they know why you're there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, in a pinch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A lot is riding on Sutan and the High-Richter going to this festival.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was really expecting more there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's just pessimism.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go buy some masks, then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you afraid they're not party people?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I worry that if we break into Sutan's house and stuff a bunch of letters there, but the High-Richter stays in with a tummy ache, then it all falls apart.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, then we go from there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's no point in worrying about things you can't change yet, Caleb.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's got a point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Be the chaos you want to see in the world.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no point in worrying, it only makes it hurt twice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, lead the way, I'll be the caboose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Who’s helming the expedition to acquire costume pieces?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Molly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say, because of your dress, I'll give you advantage on this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Show us where Melrose is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Looking for Melrose. 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11. It takes you the better part of the morning. About noon, you manage to find a place that will sell similar outfits. Since a lot of them are either custom-made for the individuals that are going, it's hard to find a place. There is no shop that sells fancy clothes to the random folks who aren't going to the event, but you manage to find a few individuals that can cobble together a few masks and basic attire. Because it's a quick build, it's going to be a little pricier than normal cost, so the commission will take the better part of the afternoon, and will be ready by sundown for enough outfits for six of you. Or accoutrements.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about to say, I don't need much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'll be fine, it's just a mask. I'd say between all of you, for the time, the materials, and the construction of it, it’ll run you about three gold pieces.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll pay that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You'll pay for all of it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. I will get reimbursed at the end.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I’ll pick up some sausages.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. How many sausages do you want?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, just the one string of them. Four or five.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe two strings.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to put you back a silver.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That says, like-- what should it be? "I'm glad to be working with you! You sure are nice!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about a sign-off, like, "The Knights of Requital are rising."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if you take a letter and just sign it “Knights of Requital” and rip off the rest, so who knows what it was, it's just from them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Knights of Requital." Then rip it, and then it is just the bottom part and leave it in the High-Richter's house.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Leave it in the trash. That's not bad, that's not bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, can somebody burn the edge like the rest was in the fire or something? Oh, and then we can put it in the fireplace like the rest of the letter was burned!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, that is the oldest trick in the book. Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Caleb, burn just these edges here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, put it down on the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But just the edges, don't set the whole thing on fire, because I spent a really long time writing that little bit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ah, well, then use a hearth fire or something, because I will probably put that into flames. Also, alternatively, would we want maybe something instead that said that "the Knights are ready for this evening’s pursuits, and they’re to support any endeavors as needed, great High-Richter. It is time for change."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I write all of that, okay, fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't write “the Knights”, though, just write the little symbol.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Then I'll put the symbol. But I'm also going to keep this one to put in the fireplace, because I think it will be really cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, the two together, but I worry that just the one piece, she could have written it down on a list of things she does not like, it's not very conclusive. But the two together.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She doesn't like red doors, she doesn't like the Knights of Requital.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now we have those letters. I'm going to keep track, I'm putting them in the side pouch, those are the side pouch ones.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have you written your letter in your thieves’ thingy that you do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. I did. My handwriting is not as good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that going in Lord Sutan's place or the High-Richter's place?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's in Sutan's place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I'm putting that in the other pouch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good, we want to tie Sutan to the Myriad, and High-Richter to the Knights, and High-Richter and Sutan together. That's the plan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To fight Orentha, to kill her.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, to take that seat. To enact the change that the people need.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We are definitely-- this is going to be real good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel so political, you guys. I feel like I'm participating in our politics, in a way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It feels nice to participate in a democracy like this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It does, it feels like I'm making a difference.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Feels like it matters.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did we get paid in advance, by the way?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are we being paid for this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we didn't get paid in advance. I hope that doesn't come back to bite us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did we get half of it, even?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's for the best, because now there's no paper trail, just in case they are trying to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is Ulog around? I'm going to look for Ulog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ulog is meeting you guys, you want to try and search for him?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to look and see if he's around us, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't see shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea where Ulog is, or if he's in the vicinity, unfortunately. All right, so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We should also-- you're invisible. We should also discuss who's going in, who's outside, how we are tackling each house.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I should definitely go into Lord Sutan's place, because I have this really fun spell that lets me find things. So I could find the seal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How does it work?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go, "I want to find this wax seal," and it will help me find the one that’s closest.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then you're right, you should go in. Nott, you should go in, because you're going to pick locks,

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If anything is locked. I strongly believe that I should go in as well, because these are two very wealthy, powerful people, and there could be magical--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to steal some stuff?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Only if that is, you know, easy to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Once again, we should leave no trace that we were there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't worry about that. I'll eat everything we leave behind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now I'm really worried about it, actually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll be out front, I can be a crownsguard if I need to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I can be in the back and be drunk and lookout.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which is our first house that we're attacking?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lord Sutan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we know that there's a guard and a dog out there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Correct, so first--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you guys need to distract the guard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With the cat. We've got the cat plan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And the sausage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And the sausage, just in case.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sausage for the guard, cat for the dog.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Regardless, even if this goes belly-up, we just disappear. You know, we have no ties to this, we walk away, yeah? We just get out with our skins, even if things go as badly as they did at the hospital, and then we go, we just walk away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, the last thing we want is for the crownsguard to think that this was all us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where are we meeting Ulog?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In front of the--

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Song and Supper Inn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh also, Frumpkin is up here in my sort of scarf position, and I bring him down in my lap, and I take the sausages out, and I sort of like knead one of the sausages in my hand a bit, and I say, you know, I'm sorry, but the next time that you go off to your pocket place and come back, this will be gone. And I start squishing sausage grease into his hair, and rubbing it down his back so that he smells like sausage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a very good plan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I love you very much, so thank you for this, okay?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (angry cat noises)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to eat him even more now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Some other time, perhaps.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll drink instead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather the outfits that were commissioned for you. You have your materials. As the day grows later, eventually the sun begins to crest over the western mountain range. The sky, though cloudy still, the colors begin to shift to the oranges and purples of dusk. You begin to see carriages come through the streets and make their way towards the Tri-Spire district.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I wonder if we can hide under the carriages and just ride in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was going to say, can we hop a ride?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of the carriages just passed you, and it's about a block up the way if you want to try and catch up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that brings a lot of attention, chasing after a carriage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's all about trying to get into the sewer system.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can't we just go to the sewers?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's just go to the sewers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you guys head back towards the entryway to the sewers, where you had previously been, with your various outfits and attire, you can see now, there's not two crownsguards, there's a single crownsguard at the moment. You approach and you see they're not directly against the grate, they're across the street. It doesn't appear to be watched at the moment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The gate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The entranceway into the sewers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe I can go talk to the guard. Distract him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It seems like they're not looking right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, he's not even looking at the gate?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, they're not looking, we can just go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, he's not looking at the entranceway to the sewer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That doesn't mean that won't change in 30 seconds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's dark outside, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, but there are lanterns and stuff up on the side of the street.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to distract him and we'll meet you on the other side?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, sure! I'll go meet you at the sewer entrance on the other side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Nott or Caleb can send you a message.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I walk up to the guard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. "Evening."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Evening, how are you doing today?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am well, how are you?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pretty good. I was wondering if you could answer a question for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everybody else, roll a stealth check, please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was looking around this area earlier for a candy shop and I couldn't find

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Try the Pentamarket, probably."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Pentamarket, um, okay. Can you tell me exactly where that is? Because I'm not familiar with the area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, so down this way--" and he starts giving you the full play-by-play of the street corners to the Pentamarket where a candy shop is that you had missed earlier. So now you know there's a candy shop in Zadash.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it's happening. What did you roll?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, natural one’s tricky.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still a natural one. But, yeah, that brings it to nine. As you guys begin to quickly slide in, one after the other, Nott, as you're rushing down, you're glancing off, because you hear them talk about candy for a second over the side.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you rush down the side, whack! You hit your head and give out a natural instinct, a pained squeak. As you do, the guard who's talking to Jester goes, “Wha--”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (fake coughs loudly) Can you help me? I think I’m choking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no. Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (fake coughs loudly)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: “Hold. Just a second.”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, I can’t breathe at all, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He begins walking over to the sewer edge. He steps over and begins to glance down--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I fall over on the ground and really like (choking sounds).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He’s looking back at you like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (choking sounds)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I send Frumpkin screeching away from us, up the street, clattering into anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From where? Out of the sewer, you mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, out of the sewer, yeah. I pop him back up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It’s the same guy, it's the same guy!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb appears at the sewer like Pennywise the Clown.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why is that their natural response in this town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, he got scared by the cat! The first guy was a dick, this guy was (yells), like kicking wildly. Anyway. He falls back and Frumpkin runs off. He’s like (grunts). It seems to be enough to take him off the scent of Nott, and he turns around. “Miss?” He walks up and helps you up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it was my spit. I was choking on my own spit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Have a good night.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you very much for all of your help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sighs) He goes back to his post. You guys make your way through the sewer, back up through the T-intersection--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mindful of the damn rats.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Rat-balloons.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I held back two minutes to let Frumpkin quietly come back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Fair enough. Frumpkin does slowly make his way back to join you. You make your way towards the gate and, without issue, are entered into the Tri-Spire. You make your way towards the side of the alleyway where the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we didn’t meet the guy at the Song and Supper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh fuck!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What guy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shit! We were supposed to go fucking meet Ulog! Damn it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We’re so good at this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester, do you want to go do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I just remembered it. I’m going to the Song and Supper Inn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We’re going to sit in the sewer like so much clown.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We recapped this at the break, too! Damn it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are sitting there, waiting for Jester to show up and meet you to let you out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I cast Message a few times. We’re here. Where are you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where letter-R letter-U?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You, however, you make your way to the Song and Supper, and on the inside, you can see, nervously at a table, in a dark cloak, Ulog. “What the--?” Gets up and meets you outside, shoves you back out there and you both begin to walk side-by-side. “I was waiting here long enough!”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We were waiting for you! It’s so weird that we totally missed you, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a deception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, well, well, 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, “Right. Well, where’s the rest of your team?”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They are-- Here’s the thing. How rich do you look? How rich does he look?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks down and he has fairly plain dark clothing for night-stealthing. He has like a single-- looks like a gold chain of some kind with a single yellowish amber-orange bead on it that looks like it’s worth a gold or two. Dark green-brown cloak. It’s hard to see the color, this late at night. He doesn’t look super rich.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I put some of my costume on him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I’ll put some of my festive wear on him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It’s all not at all fitted for him and it looks like a kid who has outgrown his snow-outfit and he’s like-- “This is humiliating.”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here, put this mask on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He’s seething beneath it. You can see him grinding his teeth, but he follows you nevertheless.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Candy-themed, too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that’s great!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You make your way to the gate once more. The guards there-- One of them walks up and, the same one from earlier, gives you a nod. “Hold.”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Guest of honor for the night. He’s a comedian.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make another deception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on! It is being so mean! Seven. God damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes, “A comedian. Tell me a joke.”

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, come on, Ulog!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ulog looks at you with the mask, back at the guard. “Um--”

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It’s open mic night! You got this! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you call a king on his birthday?” “An arsehole.” The guard goes--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here’s the thing. He’s not a joke-telling kind of comedian. He’s more of a farce kind of comedian. Physical comedy. It’s more like a jester, if you will. And I push him and-- so he falls down. See?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (impact noise) At which point the two guards go: (laugh)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He’s so good. He really sells it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ulog like gets off the ground and glares at you this very furious fiery stare and then gets up and then stumbles again and falls on the ground, flat again. The guard goes, "(laughs) All right, get in." Ulog now has like a bloody nose and as you ushers him in, he looks back. “Oh, we’re going to talk later.”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I got you in the door, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You eventually make your way over to the edge of the alley, coming up to the hatch that leads you out of the sewer. There you guys see the two approaching shapes of Jester and Ulog. Ulog looking festive, if the wear is a bit tiny, making his hair and beard poof out of the sides of the mask.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (pigeon coos)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where have you been?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got Ulog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit! We almost forgot about Ulog!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What’s Ulog’s job in this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have no freaking clue! Hey Ulog, what do you want to do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: “Well, first off, I’m pretty keen at infiltration. I have a long past of doing sort of the breaking and entering thing. Plus, I want to be there when this happens. Have a personal stake."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, he should be a part of the team that goes in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How well do you know Lord Sutan’s place and the area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: “I know the area alright.”

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We cased it earlier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: “Do you think you know where he lives?”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: “All right. That’s all we need. The rest we can all do. Lead on.”

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I insight check him? Just get a feel for that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is 17.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whispers! Whispers!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mysterious whispers!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And Far Cry 5!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Far Cry 5! It’s five better than Far Cry 0.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or four better than the original.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The fiviest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Takes place in America.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Montana.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Guys, it’s Larkin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well there goes the campaign. As you guys make your way through the city streets, you can see the closer you get to the Silken Terrace, for one, the usual silk banners that adorn the various edges of the streets have been changed from the usual white silk banners to bright yellows, bright browns, bright reds. The colors of autumn are now starting to show and appear throughout the vicinity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hate the color yellow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really? Why?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just hate it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It would look really pretty on you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don’t think that’s true.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I don’t think so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think yellow would look good on you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The blue works. Stick with it, you know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: More of a spring…

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Crownsguard are clustered in greater numbers in the Tri-Spire, specifically to keep a perimeter around the event. As you glance off to the entrance gate where you were, you can see there’s now stationed more towards that space, since you originally passed through. More musicians are arriving, some locally, some appear to be from other areas within the actual Empire. The social elite are gathering in the center of the Silken Terrace and you can now see the small carriages are stopping and letting other individuals out to join the crowds, the mingling beginning. You can already see about 60 or 70 people, with more still arriving. They all have their various colors and masks on. They’re all grabbing drinks and laughing and seeing old friends and introducing themselves to new people they haven’t met before. Some of them live in the Tri-Spire, some that live throughout and beyond.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Any of them look familiar?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don’t fuck me, Gil! Meh, you kind of fucked me there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: May I also do the same thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, no good. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, you’re too far away and the masks obscure any of sort of details. You’re unable to see anyone you recognize, per se. But you do see that there are long tables that mark the perimeter that are already holding already preset glasses of wine and ciders. You can see the central tower of the Triumph Chime sits glowing right at the front and center of this gala. It’s all surrounding the base of it. And up in a spiral you can see lanterns and similar colors of autumn that spiral up the front of it. You guys begin to, carefully, and out of sight, make your way towards the estate of Lord Sutan. Please make stealth checks, everybody.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is a lot of people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait. Who sucks?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I rolled well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who hasn’t rolled yet? Taliesin I give you a blessing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. Advantage. That’s awesome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why does it feel like you roll crappier when you’re lower level? 13.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Uh!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pretty good spread. You guys duck in between, avoiding being seen and blend in with the crowd as you pass other individuals that are making their way to the actual Gala event. There are nods and smiles, occasional laugh, as folks are conversing and chatting as they pass. You make your way over to the outskirts of the Gilded Willows, beyond the Skyscape Park and where the Constellation Bridge tower stands, to see, for many of you the first time, the three-story dark wood home of Lord Sutan. The marble pillars mark the cornerstones of where the metallic iron fence gate matches the perimeter. There’s a singular tree and still there are two guards posted at one and the same guard with the dog at the other.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Same guard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Must be getting tired.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I’m sorry. Can you set the scene? Two guards at one end and one at the other?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well it’s been a day later.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we catching them around the same time? This is his shift. Same watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seems to be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And it’s like corner-corner or front and back or…?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The house is mainly built as a rectangle, there’s the front door and the back where the cellar door is and there’s the perimeter fence.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the front, there are two guards. In the back, where the gate and the cellar door is, there’s a singular guard and his dog. The tree is up on this side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But there’s still a gate--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All the way around. With the spikes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The guard with the dog is within this perimeter of fence?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It’s just on the interior of it. Just within the gate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And the gate is closed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How wide are the openings in the gate? Does it look like the mastiff could get through the openings in the wrought-iron fence?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Probably not, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But he can still be enough of a distraction to get the guard to chase the dog while we get in if we can get the dog--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To the front side of the home.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe to the front side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe temporary though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can get in through the gate and then we get to the tree or we’re going to go straight into the cellar?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That’s what I was thinking. Go into the cellar.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could use the tree to get over the fence and then run to the cellar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As soon as the dog chases away the cat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but what about our exit? Because we have to come back out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We worry about that later?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, no, we worry about that now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe that’s when Fjord can come and relieve the guards?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can do that now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or he can do that now. But how do we get Fjord on the other side of the gate?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He walks up to him and say--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That’s very risky now because what if the guards says “I don’t know you,” you know? Then the plan never starts. If we do that at the end, at least we have a fighting chance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That’s true. I could wait.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don’t like being stuck in there though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ulog? What do you think? You’re really good at this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: “Who’s staying outside?”

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two of you. All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What were those guards’ names? There were so many guards.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was at the High-Richter’s house. That wasn’t here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah that was at the High-Richter’s.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but as long as you do a guard that’s semi-recognizable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: “If we can manage, if what you’re saying about this tree, we can possibly scoot past their visual range and not have to worry about it. And just use that as a backup.”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: “But we got to climb the tree.”

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can climb a tree. We’re good at that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The tree means worst case scenario.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I got this grapple, so we can swing across to the roof on the other side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: “All right. Those that are staying at the base. The rest of us, let’s get to climbing.”

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we hear the dog bark, we can walk by.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, I have another question. How far from the fence to the home?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It’s about five feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Five feet only.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, but spikes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I’m rethinking. If Frumpkin gets away from this dog in the beginning, he can run outside the fence and he will not be far from me. I can stay in touch with him, so when it’s time to leave I can have Frumpkin reenter the yard and create mayhem a second time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or let him create it the first time, because we might not need it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We might not, but if we have no other option and we’re trying to get out and there’s guards in both places, Frumpkin can come in and create mayhem again. Anyway, just an option.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We get to the top, you use your little cat thing to distract it. Preferably the other side of the fence."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's just a cat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right. Your cat. On the other side of the fence. While they're faced and focused in that direction, we make our ascent."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We swing it over. Somebody needs to make a loud noise when we throw the grapple over.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can cough or something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So that it doesn't make a clang sound that they hear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That might be on one of you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A natural sound.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will signal you when we are grapple throwing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you also hear me make the same sound again, that means trouble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could maybe use, like, Thaumaturgy to create a thunder sound.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, that's good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If it happens at the same time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Actually not a bad idea."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'll do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How's the weather; is it clear or grey?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sometimes thunder happens out of nowhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's cloudy.The sky itself is cloudy, and has been. Even though the storm blew by, it's still pretty heavy cloud cover.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Up the tree!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you hear me make noise--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those who are climbing the tree, athletics checks please.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go first, so I can try and help anyone else as I go up. Can I do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can do that. So Beau goes first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Athletics or acrobatics?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For climbing, we'll say athletics.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whimpers)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't have a lot of branches.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But parkour.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we get advantage because Beau's helping us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not great--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, she's got to get up there first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I got to get up there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She didn't roll that good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) You get partway up, and Ulog is actually, like (grunting). He's doing fine. So he pushes you up the rest of the way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Give me a boost!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shh!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) Sorry!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I rolled an 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You actually climb over Beau and Ulog to get to the top first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Watch my nails.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Caleb?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys all get up there. Beau is the last to arrive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (pants)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought you were a monk of some sort.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sprinter. I'm not an endurance person. Okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's one if those things, too, where she starts first, but each person keeps putting their feet in her face on the way up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're all legs and no arms.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're up in the branches, in the bow, at the top. You can see now, it's a beautiful view of the gala in the distance. You can see the three towers, all arcing up, all lit from underneath from the lanterns and the light that have been significantly brightened for the events of the evening. You have a clear shot of the rooftop, which is at a slight decline from this current position. It's about ten feet from you, and about three feet down below. You can see there are two smokestacks that look like they're attached to fire places that might be good indicators of places to connect the rope. Who's throwing the rope?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should I try it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're strongest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is this? Why do--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a grapple. Connected to a rope.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I hand the other side of the rope to Ulog so it doesn't fall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes it. He's like, "All right. You got to be pretty good at aiming this."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, are you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's about 15, 20 feet from here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I'm strong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But can you aim it?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but you're weak, aren't you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know. I feel like I'm more precise than you. But, no, you're strong. You go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but you're precise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin is pacing back and forth just outside the fence.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Parchment, boulder, shears?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. On three?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, on three. One. Two. Three! Okay, you're throwing it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I'll throw it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So go ahead and roll a d20 and add your strength modifier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, strength.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You throw it. Tink, tink.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thunder, thunder! When I did it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. There's this roll of thunder off in the distance. It didn't catch anything, though, and it's scraping. Pulling back a little bit--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: More thunder. Another thunder.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not staying on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It didn't manage to. It got over to the roof, but it didn't catch anything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Reel it back in. Reel it back in!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't let it get caught.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do another thunder sound right when I pull it, so it doesn't make noise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you pull it and it scrapes, falls, and then dangles down. You manage to pull it up a little bit, dangle it up, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give me that. Give me that!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here! It is a strength thing, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (squeaks)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you just throwing it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've lost our grapple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. No, Ulog was holding onto the end of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is anyone going to do anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I catch-- I try to catch the rope to try to keep it from hitting the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could try.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy. Try!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll try.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know what to do!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I did; I tried!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it flying out of our grasp; is that what’s happening?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's going to try, so go ahead and roll a d20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's going to try and catch it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled a 19. I don't know what I'm adding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. That's fine. So you manage to just catch it, holding onto the edge of the rope, before it clanks onto the ground. It's just dangling now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pull it slowly back up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You said strength. I threw it as hard as I could throw it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Quiet, shut up!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thunder!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) Okay, maybe if I get over, I could hold the other end and help people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can jump ten feet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, dear lord. What if you fall on the ground, Beau?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let this happen. Let this happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can make this jump.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You going to try?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to take a breath, gather my chi. Along the edge of the branch anime run--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll give you advantage because of the step of the wind.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Step of the wind gives me, like, double jump distance, or triple jump--dump jist--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Triple dump!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Triple dungeness crabs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, we had ring of truth cast. You can't lie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Taliesin did a triple dump earlier.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did. Solid.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your jump distance is doubled! Yeah, you're fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (victorious laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just roll for the hell of it. I just want to see what happens.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just so it's not a one. No ones!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It won't be a one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You, off the branch, leap. No sound.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go along the rope, and tighten the rope as I land.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The rope's not-- Oh, were you holding onto the grapple?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's got the other end.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was, like, tracing the rope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You grab it, affix it easily to one of the smokestacks you find up there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She is really cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's amazing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great. So we'll tie off the other side-- Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ulog takes it and ties the other side of the rope. You guys can all begin to shimmy across and make your way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) We shimmy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. The rope is set up. Are you guys just going to shimmy across?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: When do we do the cat?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wait, do we have to cast-- Do we have to have a-- Distraction!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The cat.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we're going to shimmy across. Because what if the guard looks up and sees us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Only, Frumpkin is down at the bottom of the tree. He runs around and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we do that now!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I think--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we do that--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When we lower into the cellar, right when--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we're going through the roof now, I thought. No?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well how--?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, hold on. Is there entry through the roof?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not there. You can't see it from here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We can't see from here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There is a chimney stack, though, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A chimney stack? We're not Santa Claus!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a door on the roof? How would there be a stupid door on the roof?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There could be.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sometimes there's balconies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's no balconies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no balconies on this house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Look around for a door on the roof!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What? Who would have a door on the roof?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Rich people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look around. Is there a door on the roof?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe like an attic access or something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: French roof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18? You don't find an entry way per se. One of the chimneys is wide enough for someone to pass through. It looks like there is a part of the roof that, if you were to try and remove some of the shingles, there might be some sort of entrance below it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're on an angle there, on each side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It looks like they need to re-roof. Like they haven't done it in about 15 years. Right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So maybe we could get in. Or, go through the cellar. Or, be like Santa Claus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we should go in through the roof.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Let's shimmy across. Make the distraction now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We already shimmied.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No we didn't!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's happening now. It's real time. Real time! I think.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sending Frumpkin now, okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go. Sausage cat!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as Frumpkin runs past (cat yowling) outside of the gate. Immediately (dog barking). He's like, "No!" (guard stuttering) The dog drags him to the opposite side, like around the outside, into the fence and is now trying to bite. And Frumpkin's on the other side of the fence, going (meows and hisses). (barking), right into the fence. The guy's still holding back, like "Shit, no, stop! God, stop it!" Is pulling. You guys all make it across--no one seems to notice, none the wiser--onto the roof.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Nott. Send a message to Fjord and say, "Hey, did we look cool, just then?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did they go already?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He said, "Did they go already?" (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I heard a dog barking. I feel that this plan was no better than ours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are watching; you guys are on--?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We’re keeping an eye on the street.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check from both you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where are they in relation to us too, by the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're on a corner, like far enough away from the house not to be a problem.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to know if you're within view of the guard with the dog's initial position.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Keeping an eye out there, there isn't any, at the moment, notable individuals wandering towards, or snooping around the house or your position. So you feel pretty safe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You look like a guard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not yet. I should. Yeah, I'll wander into an alley.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And change into a crownsguard? Okay. Got it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got my cards out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys, you are on the roof.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There was a guard named Cloen, who was the guard who saw the spider.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are two chimneys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just throwing that out there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is the slight roof thing that you saw.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So what I would do is also, once we're in position on the roof, is I would tell Frumpkin to back off away from that dog, out of vision, and wait a few minutes, because he's within a hundred feet of me. If so, we're good. Tell him to find Molly, and sit with Molly. He'll always listen to me, but I'm also sending him the command to listen to Molly, if need be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easy enough to do. All right. So.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't know that. But, still.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The barking slows. The dog is still barking in the direction of what was there, and seems to be still really entranced with the possibility of getting that fucking cat. Frumpkin does find his way to you, Molly. Guys on the roof, what are you doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Got to get through this roof.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What were you saying? I did not hear you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pry at the shingles. Look at how deep these go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go down the chimney.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, good, we covered-- If we do the shingles, how do we cover them up when we leave? We're trying to leave no trace.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who gives a shit? Who's going to be on the fucking roof?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I step around. How do the shingles feel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some of them loosen and slip a little bit, and you can see there's a very, very faint groove on the wood beneath it. Like a gap.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not everyone can fit through the chimney.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a dagger?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have a shortsword.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I borrow it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a dagger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I borrow any bladed thing? Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't like to lend my items out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to jack it up and see if I can--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast thunder. Thaumaturgy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (thunder rumbling) off in the distance. As you begin to pry a little bit, it begins to move up. There is some sort of a hatch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it feel like a trap door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It feels like a trap door a little bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As it's pulling up, the shingles that are overlapped on it are overlapping the gap and start sliding a little bit. You immediately feel like if you open this, you're going to send a bunch of shingles sliding off of the roof.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, get them. Get them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go down the chimney. At least I can go down there and look to see if it's possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a very faint trail of smoke coming out of the chimney, by the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a fire in there. What if we pull up these shingles?

lines.name: MARISHA

It opens up just enough that you can slip inside, and there is a small ladder there that you can use to slowly get down into a small attic.

lines.text: Jester. As you finish concentrating on the spell and focusing on the wax seal, you get a blip of its location in the next chamber beyond where you are in the door on the right.

lines.text: As this is happening, Ulog is sighing loudly, pulls out some tools, and begins to fiddle with where the boards are on the ground. So you manage to get your tool underneath, and you find where the spring is, it's barely in the space between where the door and the edge of the door frame is. You get the tool underneath, capture it, and as you pull the door open it prevents the spring from pulling back into the device. You slowly, as you expose it, reach in, snap the opposing side and remove the spring entirely, leaving the trap inert.

It has two giant statues of lions on each side, this cool detailed shelf there. You can see a table with chairs to your left. You can see a slight opening to a balcony that's not visible from the outside.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.text: Natural 20! As they're having this conversation, you glance by the fireplace, the fire is crackling in there, and you glance down and right underneath the hearth, up where the fire's tickling, you see a piece of the stonework that doesn't match the others, it's slightly off-colored. It looks like the burning of the fire that's been given this dark and blackened look to it, there's one brick there that doesn't seem to have been affected by any of the soot at all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I, avoiding the rug, lightly step over it, and see if I can jiggy the brick out.

lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.text: Do I see any change in the abjuration magic when she does that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.text: What you just did dispelled whatever ward was on the cabinet, however the carpet I can't tell exactly what's going on but there is something--

lines.text: Give me the papers.

lines.text: I cast Mage Hand and slowly peel back a corner of the carpet.

lines.text: Okay, the carpet peels back and it reveals beneath it a section of the wood that has a hinge bolted to one side of it. It's a square that's cut out of it, it looks like it's an open case. The carpet peels back, and then begins to fold back in its space, and then fold up again. It begins to slightly shift and rise, and the carpet almost seems to be gliding in the air on its own in the vicinity. It spins towards you and then

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're fighting a carpet! The fuck!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're fighting a carpet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We had it coming.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's an animated object!

lines.text: I had that in my one-shot.

lines.text: My kids have fought a broom. This happens.

lines.name: LAURA

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.text: Oh no!

lines.text: That's fine, I'll use this. I'll say that that's him there, it's fine. Given that case, guys, first it's a surprise round, as it whips its way over towards Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It

lines.text: It does, because it suddenly rushes in your direction. That is going to be a 21 to hit.

lines.text: Oh, this is going to suck.

lines.text: Currently you are enveloped by the Rug of Smothering.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Rug of Smothering.

lines.text: Initiative here. Top of the round, 25 to 20 anybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau. 15 to 10?

lines.text: What'd you get Caleb?

lines.text: Well you know, I rolled a nine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) You're the best around! Nothing's ever going to bring you down!

lines.text: It's true! Nott, it's your turn first. You are restrained, you are blinded, and you are suffocating. At the start of your turn, you immediately take 12 points of bludgeoning damage as it's now crushing and constricting your entire body. You feel the life being pulled out of you as you're gasping for breath in this space. What are you going to do with your turn?

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: Yes, you can still talk. You're (muffled sounds). You still have the breath you had in your body when it went around you, so I'll say you have enough air for one spell and then that's all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I will touch it with Shocking Grasp, cast Shocking Grasp on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that a spell attack roll?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's touch, to hit plus five. So I have to roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you would have disadvantage because you're restrained, but it's also smothering you so I would give you advantage to that, so it's just a straight roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 13 plus five. 18!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits! Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: Nope!

lines.text: Okay. You see it wrapping around and Nott's flailing about as this carpet is crushing her little body. Go ahead and--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Natural 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, that hits. Go ahead and roll damage on that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's 4d6. Radiant.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, get it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Damn!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 15 damage, and the next attack has advantage against it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasping) Oh no!

lines.text: Oh no, I'm sorry, Nott!

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: Where am I?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, how do we get it off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. I'm going to run up with my staff and do a crack crack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but--

lines.text: Let me do my fucking thing, man. Let me do my fucking thing.

lines.text: I have no fucking clue.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.text: No, but you just heard Nott scream!

lines.text: No one knows, who the fuck knows?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, Nott. Crack!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 16 for the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits. Roll damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, that is six damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's three to you, Nott.

lines.text: Are you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For the second one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, you're going to kill Nott!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That hits. That's a natural 16. And that's seven damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven damage. That's four damage to the thing and you fail a death saving throw.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now I'm going to spend a ki point.
